descript.abstract: This is a mathematically generated grid in which each polygon represents one quarter of the already quartered 225 second (or 3 3/4 minute) data resource, or a quarter-quarter of a standard USGS 7 1/2 minute quadrangle. The result is a 1 7/8 minute quadrangle layer which nests within the standard USGS quads and whose tile naming scheme includes reference to the parent quadrangles. Known as the "Quarter-Quarter Quad" tile index.
descript.purpose: To provide a standard framework for accessing and creating data sets tiled by "quarter-quarter-quad." Especially for use with collecting, organizing, and distributing LiDAR data and derived products.

idinfo.useconst: Use of the data are constrained only by the DNR GIS Data License Agreement

dataqual.logic: All polygons are closed and lines intersect where intended.
dataqual.complete: All 1 7/8 minute blocks that are part of 250K blocks that fall entirely or partially within the state Minnesota are included.

procstep.procdesc: Attributes were derived directly from the parent coverage (q024ine4). Each polygon was assigned the tile-name of the parent polygon, appending two additional 2-digit codes to subset the indivudual quarater-quarter sections.

attr.attrdef: The UTM zone for which the coordinates of the label point was calculated. Field is part of the default set of attributes used by MGS.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).
